title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Pembroke Pines, FL)
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online via Indeed
Recv’d email to do assessment 
Recv’d message via Indeed from recruiter setting expectations about salary and hybrid schedule. After I replied I recv’d an email to do a phone interview with recruiter 
The questions were situational based, nothing too difficult. She appeared pleased with our interview and stated she was recommending me to move forward.
Recv’d Teams meeting request to meet 3 members of the leadership team. Interview was extremely pleasant and stress free. The ladies were nice and interview was more like a conversation. They expressed teamwork a lot and of course integrity. Next day recv’d another message from recruiter asking to meet with VP and director again. That interview was very informal and quick. A couple days later I recv’d a tentative offer and began my background check and reference check. Next day recv’d official offer letter and set to start soon. Entire process took about 2-3 weeks.
Interview Questions: How to you handle situations?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: Just did a phone interview. The interviewer just asked basic STAR questions. Asked a lot of questions involving very specific instances in your previous roles. After the phone interview I received an email about a zoom interview 2 days later.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? Explain a specific situation when you stepped up and went above and beyond in a previous role.

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Strayer University (Charlotte, NC) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Worst interview I've ever been in, the interviewer did not know what he was doing or prepared at all. Obviously reading from a script and when I would answer his questions he would literally repeat my entire answer back as he typed it in. It seemed like he was not listening and was patronizing me when he was listening. After 30 minutes of patronizing and being completely inept, I felt like my time was being wasted and I promptly ended the interview. I have never ended an interview in the middle of an interview until now. It was an embarrassment for me and Strayer should feel embarrassed about the incompetency of their employees.
Interview Questions: Tell me a SPECIFIC time you went above and beyond on the job

title: Campus Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: Streamlined, need to know key business metrics. Knowledge of Admissions and retention protocols, and have a strong sense of your leadership style. Must know how to work through student issues, while also ensuring academic rigor is present.
Interview Questions: Describe your leadership style and how others have responded to your leadership?

title: Career Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter called to set up an interview with the Campus Director.  I was interviewed in person by a panel of 4. They were very nice and welcoming. I received a call the next day from the recruiter to off the job. He went over next steps for onboarding.
Interview Questions: What interests me about the position?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview, Microsoft Teams Interview, then Final Microsoft Teams Interview. Team is great, seems like a great place to work. Very big on protecting students and employees from COVID which was nice.
Interview Questions: If you were an animal, what would you be and how could its abilities help you in this position?

title: Campus Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: First you are interviewed by HR. Then you go in to be interviewed in person. Next you submit your references. Lastly, you go through a background check. HR will then contact you after the process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position ?

title: Learning Resources Center Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Campus Dean for a brief in-person interview. The interview was brief and really a means to get acquainted, since I already had experience with the company in a similar role.
Interview Questions: What style of management do you prefer working with?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: 5 interviews but was pretty easy.  the time between was pretty quick until the last and then it seemed to take forever to get feedback.  once a couple weeks went by, i was able to get some feedback and they made an offer but during that time i found a new role and accepted the offer so i declided the offer from strayer.  i did like them though and would entertain a new offer should they give another one.
Interview Questions: behavior questions STAR method of answers

title: Campus Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: This was a normal interview process. I appreciated the quick turnaround between my application submission and their request for me to interview with the school. Nothing stood out about the process.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your last position?

title: Campus Dean Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews seemed to go well, but then was ghosted. After getting no response neither from the recruiter nor the hiring manager, I found out through social media that they hired someone. Several weeks later I received a generic rejection email from human resources. I understand not getting a reply had I never been interviewed. However, I expected professional courtesy after having three interviews.
Interview Questions: Describe how I would increase student retention.

title: Campus Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview during call back followed up by second in person interview with 3 managers. Must submit resume and verifiable references. Process took about 2 weeks to complete full background check.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with an upset student

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Strayer University in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Strayer has a great interview process that allows the individual to truly understand the organizational goals.  The position overview was detailed and forth coming and the interview panel was extremely informative.
Interview Questions: How does your experience align with the current open position.

title: Full Time Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: The process was fairly simple.  I applied online and received an email to schedule the 1st interview with HR Rep, which was done by phone.  The  2nd interview was then schedule a week later with Provost of Academics and was done through an online Webex meeting.  The 3rd panel interview with staff/faculty was done via a Webex meeting.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your experience working with a team?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: Included director and manager. Very relaxed interview process. Phone interview happens first and then face to face. Asked basic interview questions and previous job history questions. Overall very good interview process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here.

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Memphis, TN) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough. It was nice meeting the staff. Was also provided with a tour and everyone was very welcoming. Overall a great experience and probably one of the best interviews I’ve ever had.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted the job and what I had to bring to the table.

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Strayer University (Knoxville, TN) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with two directors and the whole admission staff - first with just two and then i got to meet the whole staff they asked questions as well and then i had the floor to ask anything. They were very nice and welcoming
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions - weakness/ strength but really want you to expand on each one

title: Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: Very casual by supervisors that have done the same job as yourself. Very standard questions. Customer service experience and college experience preferred. Hiring is very simple. If you can speak, you'll pass.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Student Services Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was ok, however, after the job was offered and I resigned from my former employer did denied my employment. Do not give any notice to your employer without letting the whole process come to a conclusion . Now I’m unemployed. The recruiter should have told me not to give notice until the whole process was completed. After the offer it took 1 month for these awful people to give me a final answer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Financial Aid Solutions Team Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Strayer University (Chantilly, VA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty standard, where two of the managers interviewed me. They asked me general questions about what my strengths and weaknesses are and what was my preferred work environment. Then, they asked me if I had any questions for them.
Interview Questions: What are you strengths and how have you demonstrated them in previous jobs?

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Strayer University (Raleigh, NC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview. Generally, there are three to four people involved in the decision making for instructor hiring.  This is the more common process for on ground teaching. The process may be slightly different for online interviewing as it may involve a Webex meeting with multiple individuals.
Interview Questions: Presentation Involved. Questions were specific to subject area and methods of relating to student behavior.

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Memphis, TN) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and the very next day received an email from their corporate HR Rep to set phone interview. Phone interview took place the following day, went well and received a phone call from Campus Director to schedule in-person interview. 
I interviewed a week after phone call with Campus Director.
Interview Questions: How would I encourage a prospective student, who is unsure, to attend Strayer? (Role Play)

title: Campus Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Morrow, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Very simply. They want you to dig deep and finds things about yourself that you can improve on; they also want you to be honest about your strengths. It was a great process
Interview Questions: If we called your supervisor right now, what would they say you need to improve on?

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Strayer University (Herndon, VA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Screening interview, interview with hiring manager, on site interview. "We move quickly" involved never contacting me again, despite follow up. Very unprofessional, just send an email stating that you selected someone else.
Interview Questions: Tell us about X position. How did you get it?

title: Library Resource Center Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Augusta, GA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very easy 15 minute Recruiter leads to in depth campus dean interview, to face to face interview. Then they will check your references and background if you make it that far.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have

title: Onsite Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Strayer University (Basking Ridge, NJ) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: This is considered a mid level position but they treated it as an executive position.  I had 7 rounds of interviews.  I first applied online and received an email from their recruiter within 7 days.  Had a phone conversation with her, few days later a phone interview with the hiring manager, few days later phone interview with the dean of the offsite.  The following weeks had an in person interview with the hiring manager, in person interview with the Dean, and an in person interview with their bosses.  All were extremely nice and personable.  The hiring manager basically told me she loved me and I was the best candidate but I had one more round of interviews with two higher ups.  Before that interview my references were contacted.  The final interview was something I have never experienced in my life and I have interviewed at a variety of universities in my career.  It was a phone interview and the two women tag teamed me with questions and questioned my answers. Also, they wanted me to use a camera for the interview in which no one told me and my computer at home did not have.  When I got off the last phone call I knew I did not get the job.  The last thing they told me was I would hear fairly quickly as this is a position that needs to be filled fast.  Today, 4 weeks later I got the generic email we are going with another candidate.  I expected this and I am not upset but it’s a shame almost 2 months of interviewing and that is all I get.
Interview Questions: How do you get a person to speak to you at a recruitment table?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Strayer University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The background check is extensive and takes about two months to actually hire on. The interview is a two round process with 2-3 interviewers present. I submitted an application online, I had a recruiter follow up with a phone screen. From there, an in person interview was scheduled. My in person interview was with two people, and then I was invited back for a second round interview. I followed up numerous times before receiving an offer. Once I received an offer, it took two months to complete the on boarding process.
Interview Questions: Who is your hero and why

title: Campus Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: First you get an email to set up a phone interview. After the phone interview the hiring manager will gave you a call and if the second phone interview with the hiring manager goes well then they will ask you to come in for an interview. Once the in person interview goes well finally a background and reference check is performed. Lastly you get a starting date after both the background and reference check is completed.
Interview Questions: If it is a busy day and two students are complaining and the supervisors need you to complete the task... who will you help first and why.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Columbus, GA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I went through an interview with the hiring manager, the dean, and then a sample lecture to 3 deans. It was VERY detailed, but it also gave me the information needed to know if this was the company for me.
Interview Questions: You are dealing with adult learners with other responsibilities, what do you do if you see they aren't as interested in the class anymore?

title: Campus Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process itself is fairly short, but the process of getting hired is long. I applied and was called the next day. They said that they would give my information to the hiring manager and she would set up an interview. It took a week to hear from the hiring manager; I received a request for references the next day. It took a half week for them to process the references and provide me with an offer. The background check is about a week or two and then you are provided with a start date.
Interview Questions: If we called your manager right now, what is something that they say that you need to improve about yourself?

title: Student Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was pretty quick.  As you apply, the resumes are automatically routed to the hiring manager. The hiring manager will then review and decide if an interview is necessary.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to deal with a difficult customer?

title: Digital Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Strayer University (Herndon, VA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Unprofessional hiring process. Had a phone interview, was invited to come in. Spent 3 hours doing interviews with the department, for them to say, 'we're hiring internally'. Why waste my time? Think it was just a fake interview for them to comply with HR.
Interview Questions: What's your favorite excel function?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with 3 people Campus Director, and two Admissions Officers. The interview lasted approx. 1 hour, each interviewer seemed fairly nice. I was asked standard behavioral questions such as "Tell me about yourself", they also went over my resume and asked about my role in previous positions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an Admissions Officer?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Strayer University (Nashville, TN) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy interview and irrelevant videos required.  Repeated requests for personal information and unofficial transcripts although the information submitted previously.  All contact by email and website application process.  A phone contact may have solved the communication problem, yet the tone of the online contacts had already convinced me that this was not a school I would like to work for.
Interview Questions: Send a video with introduction to a class

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Strayer University (Herndon, VA)
Interview Descriptions:
I came in through a staffing agency, so there was a preliminary call with the hiring manager followed by an in-person interview with the hiring manager and team. The next round would have been an in-person meeting with the senior leaders of that division.

I say that it would have been because I removed my candidacy after the in-person interview. My conversations with the hiring manager went really well and I was impressed. However, the team asked me what I thought of the hiring manager as part of my interview. This struck me as odd and I couldn't shake it.
Interview Questions: What do you think of our current marketing? How would you define the brand voice/tone?

title: Campus Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied one morning and received a call after lunch the same day. I spoke with the Dean and Director for about 15 minutes. They invited my to an in-person later that day. Interview was lengthy because we really got to know one another. Your typical scenario questions, strengths/weaknesses, description of your work ethic etc.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you and your supervisor did not agree on something and how did you resolve?

title: Learning Resource Center Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Strayer University (Nashville, TN) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: It started with a written test/quiz that consisted of 10 multiple choice questions about how to cite references in research papers. After that, two folks interviewed me. They took turns reading questions and making notes of my answers. At times I felt like they weren't listening to my answers, they were just trying to fill out the interview form. Several times I had to help summarize my answer so they would know what to write down.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to use an online database.

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Strayer University (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied and called a week later to follow up about my status. They set me up for an interview a week later. The interview went well and was pretty basic. A week later they offered me the position.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had a project and failed

title: Director Role Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Strayer University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening, Panel Interview, One on One interview with a VP.  Strayer Talent Recruiters are very effective and prompt.  You can receive a phone call from a recruiter and an interivew could be scheduled within days for a management position.  Entry level positions may take longer because it will be at the hiring managers discretion how soon you will be contacted.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were scenarios and scripted.  You will be asked to detail a time or an encounter with a customer, student, colleague, etc...

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Strayer University (Charlotte, NC) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was pretty straight forward. A friend referred me to the recruiter who after I submitted my application called me to schedule my phone interview. The recruiter over the phone was very pleasant and asked your basic STAR questions. At the end of the phone interview the recruiter told me that they would be in contact. 

I was pretty sure I had botched the phone interview because it was two weeks later I got the in person interview. In the second interview you meet with the head of the admissions office and the head Admissions officer. They both interview you at the same time. The interview was great and again they asked the same STAR questions you should expect from other places. I had no idea how much I really saw myself in the position or really wanted to work with this office. 

They really have the best interests for their students and setting them up for success. They had wonderful things to say about my personal resume. Namely working full time, enrolled full time, managing to find an internship and still getting into three honor societies. It appeared to me they were looking for an applicant that mimicked their student population. At the end of the interview they gave me their contact information and promised a reply that Friday. I never heard from them. Which was sad because I really liked them and their atmosphere.
Interview Questions: What would you consider your greatest achievement?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Strayer University (Birmingham, AL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Application. Interview on local campus. Presentation to Dean and Administrators. Phone Interview. Phone Interview. On-line Instruction Demonstration for Dean of Faculty to show competency for On-line teaching positions. Background including references.
Interview Questions: How much experience in the field and teaching experience.

title: Online Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Washington, DC) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: One short phone interview with Dean. Then, another 1-hr "Go to Meeting" interview with Dean and some of the faculty members. I had to do a video teaching demonstration on a topic of my choice.
Interview Questions:
1. Current challenges in teaching
2. Teaching style and philosophy

title: Learning Resource Center Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Washington, DC) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was Interviewed by a panel of 2; it was a very relaxed environment (they offered me food and something to drink).  Questions about the job I applied for were pretty basic and followed the job description and my experience towards what was expected from me for the job.
Interview Questions: Give an example when you helped someone with a homework assignment.

title: Academic Services Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Strayer University (Baltimore, MD) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: After applying I was contacted for a 15 minute phone interview. One day later I was contacted for an on campus interview with a regional representative. She only asked 3 behavioral questions from her laptop. She didn't seem interested in hearing about me as a candidate. When I asked questions about employee retention I was told "no one leaves, everyone loves it here. The only reason people leave is for a promotion". I knew that wasn't true. When I asked her specifically how long people have been within their positions, she said she couldn't quote me an answer because it could become a legal issue. It was very odd. I felt like I was in Wayward Pines.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Strayer University (Cedar Hill, TX)
Interview Descriptions: After the initial call, they had me come in and do a mock lecture before them. There were about 3 present in the room. They each had the opportunity to ask me questions ranging from my background to my passions.
Interview Questions: Typically they asked questions of how problems were solved in the past and the results. They also asked what went well about the presentation I just gave and what could have been done better.

title: Campus Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Three panel interview process and you will be asked several questions as it pertains to your education and how you can help them grow.  What makes you a great leader.  You will be asked what your past work environment was like and how did you lead the organization.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good leader?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Strayer University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: They have you talk with a recruiter at first. If you have met with the campus before, they will decide to not allow you to come in at all. The interviewer will then start to downplay what you do, and talk like they don't feel that you can do anything.
Interview Questions: If money wasn't an issue, what would you do with your time?

title: Student Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application online and then received a call for interview dates. It was a group of other applicants present and a panel interviewed me.   Lastly, I was called and presented with a job offer.
Interview Questions: scenario questions

title: Academic Services Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Strayer University (Raleigh, NC) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Application was submitted, an interview was scheduled within 2 days of receipt of application, interview held within three days of scheduling. The position required knowledge of certain academic roles and processes which I prepared for. I prepared for the interview by bringing questions or my own and highlighting certain terms I was not clear on defining.
Interview Questions: What did I know about the position.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: 15-minute teaching demonstration, interview, by a panel, area Deans, recruiter calls, Dean arranges interview time. In a classroom so take a thumb drive to show teaching ability, use technology, engage the audience. Use handouts, be interesting. Ask questions, follow up. Know about the company. The audience is sympathetic and supportive. It is not a scary, gotcha type of setting.
Interview Questions:
Most difficult student and how did you handle?
Student disagree with grades, how did you handle?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Allentown, PA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I was called for interview which comprised of a 10-15 mins presentation of teaching ability and an HR interview that lasted 30 minutes. There were 3 interviewers and they were all nice and friendly.
Interview Questions: How do you manage time when there are many pressing issues?

title: Campus Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and within a week I was invited to interview. It was a phone interview first, then another week of waiting, then I was invited to the panel interview, then another week of waiting, then I was invited to do a background check, then another week of waiting and I was told that I got the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about an experience when you faced a challenge at your job...a time when someone wasn't doing what they were supposed to...

title: Computer Lab Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Strayer University (Garner, NC) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with the Dean of the campus, the LRC manager, and a person from HR (who did not understand the job at all, and I almost did not get the job becasue of her lack of knowledge about the position). Overall it was a good interview process.
Interview Questions: Did I have any problems in helping out any student that would need help.

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: First I received a call from HR, which was a prescreening. At the end of the call I was told that my info would be forwarded to the hiring manager and I would receive a call within a couple of days. I received that call, which was a phone interview. Then I was asked to do an interview at the location. I have interviewed and now I'm waiting on the next steps...
Interview Questions: I was asked to role play.

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: At the beginning, you have a max of 10 minutes to do an introduction.  After that, I had to teach a 15-20 minute lesson to a 4 person interview panel.  After teaching the lesson, I was asked some of the typical interview questions. It has been about a month since my interview and still haven't heard anything.
Interview Questions: How do you reach the difficult students?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Strayer University (Cherry Hill, NJ) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: 15 minute presentation on a area of expertise was then followed up  with 15-20 minute review with questions about teaching experience. The questions were difficult and I was interviewed by two senior faculty members.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when you had to handle confident information about a student

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Strayer University (Newport News, VA)
Interview Descriptions: I was called the very next day...possibly the same day that I applied.  I was scheduled for an interview the next day and interviewed with two different people.  Then, I asked back and was interviewed by two people.  I do not remember having a phone interview.  I do remember them using a targeted interview style and asking me questions that required multi-step answers.  I know I had to back (in my mind) and making sure that I was answered the questions accurately.  They did not mind if I asked them to repeat themselves.  We even had a casual conversation after the interview (on the 1st interview).  The second interviewers were a little more straightforward,
Interview Questions: Tell us about your last job and explain a time where you make a hard decision - explain what the decision was, what was the response, and do you feel it was the right decision in the end.

title: LRC Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Nottingham, MD) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process started out with a sit-down conversation with the LRC Manager while applying for school. I was then told to submit my application online through the Strayer website. A couple days later i received a phone call scheduling an interview, which was a panel interview with the LRC Manager, campus director, and campus manager. After performing a background investigation i was called and given a job offer for the position.
Interview Questions: What is the thing i enjoy the most about helping others.

title: SFS Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: very professional and smooth. had the phone interview then later on the face to face interview on campus. everyone was very polite and helpful. extreme growth and opportunity at this company
Interview Questions: what made you apply for this position outside the obvious reason, layoffs

title: LRCA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: Applied Monday, received phone interview Wednesday, Face to face scheduled Friday for the following Wednesday. The interview was with multiple people. I informed that I was moving along the application process Friday and needed a background/reference check. Awaiting final approval.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? Can you handle conflict?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Strayer University (Newport News, VA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: If was rather easy, had to prepare a lesson and teach it for about to minutes to the dean and then, when i was told to stop, it went into questions about self and certain scenario based situations.
Interview Questions:
We have a lot of military students, that may miss class, how would you handle their case?
In addition, they may miss turning in their paper or assignments late, how would you handle that?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online on company website. Recruiter  contacted the next day asked qualified questions, lasted 15 minutes. Thereafter contacted by campus for in person interview. Hiring mama get canceled had to reschedule another date for interview. Mostly behavioral questions. Then a phone interview  with regional director.
Interview Questions: Dedescribe a situation in which you were able to persuasion to successfully get someone to see things your way

title: Adjunct Faculty Statistics Strayer University Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: huge questionaire, lots of questions on opinions / personal information required. There was a long test of abilities / preferences / character treats. The web pages are not easy to navigate, I'm still unsure if my application is completely complete.
Interview Questions: . One part included questions on quantitative abilities under limited time to response (I didn't even have my calculator with me)

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Strayer University (Ashburn, VA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is handled very professionally!  First you apply, then if your qualifications meet the needs of the company, you are contacted by HR-Recruiting who will do a pre-screen interview (usually over the phone) where YOU will have the chance to be sure the position is right for you.  If you and Recruiting agree its a good match, you are referred to the hiring manager for further interview process.  This could be a simple one-on-one or a full-smash two/three-stage panel interview (depends on the position).  Once that is completed, if you are selected you are notified by HR-Recruiting and officially offered the position.  Its amazing!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Support Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Strayer University in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: You will be interviewed over the phone by HR. If hat goes well then you will be interviewed by a panel (the campus manager, campus dean and Student Support Manager). If that goes well, then your last interview will be with the regional manager.
Interview Questions: The interview was based on the STAR (Situation, Task, Action and Result) technique. The main focus is on customer service and being a team player. They will ask you something like - Tell me about a situation where you have had to speak with an unhappy student/customer?

title: Admissions Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Strayer University (Marietta, GA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: My first meeting was with the Admissions Director and the second was with the regional Vice President. Both meetings were cordial but the confidence in their company was not absent.
Interview Questions: The focus of most of the questions were related to my past productivity as an admissions officer with Strayer and AIU.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: Very easy if you are prepared with a solid presentation. Don't do prep, you won't get a job. Demonstrate your passion for adult learning, it is central to the mission.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Miami, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is two fold.  You are interviewed over the phone by an HR representative or hiring manager.  Then you are usually brought in for a one-on-one interview, then a panel interview which features scenario type questions.  And lastly you meet with a regional VP for final approval.
Interview Questions: Nothing overly difficult.

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview followed by face to face interview. The interview process was not lengthy at all. The atmosphere was really relaxed and I was given alot of information about the job.  Many of the quaetions were behavior based question so those who interview should be ready.
Interview Questions: If you were a car what kind of car what you be?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: Strayer tends to favor panel interview styles, with one candidate in front of 3 or 4 different managers. They have a set interview question guide that they use, but they do come up with their own questions as they deem necessary. Since the Admissions Officer position, they tend to look for someone who could be described as a good salesperson, and indeed many of the people they hire have a background in sales and retail. Since most of the "selling" is over the phone, I have heard of Admissions Officer candidates being asked to do a mock "sales call" on the spot with the interviewers. Aggressive, sales persons are typically preferred, with those with experience with high-pressure metrics practically hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: It wasn't a question that threw me off, but the rudeness of my interviewers. After I was made to wait for 3+ hours for my scheduled interview, my interviewer said that he was concerned about "my apparent introvert personality" during the interview. I am NOT an introvert- I was mentally drained after waiting for hours, without explanation of apology for the delay.

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 rounds of interviews plus an initial phone screen. The interviews were lengthy, but very thorough--this team really wants the applicant to truly understand the pros/cons of the position, which was incredibly refreshing.
Interview Questions: Would you enroll a student who was a bad fit for Strayer, even though it could mean not reaching your enrollment quota if you didn't?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Charlotte, NC) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied through their website and was contacted by a recruiter a few weeks later. I had a 45 minute phone interview with the recruiter in which he told me in detail about the position, benefits, pay, and asked me a multitude of questions. A lot of the questions he asked were situational, "tell me about a time when..." relating to my work experiences. After my phone interview he forwarded my resume on to the hiring manager who contacted me the next day and we set up an in-person interview at the Charlotte campus. At that interview, I was asked a lot more situational questions. They had me go through my interview, asked to explain to them my interpretation of the job, and asked why I was applying to do this. Both of the women who interviewed me were very nice and not intimidating at all. I felt very comfortable the whole time and they were easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: If money was not an object and you didn't have to work, what would you do?

title: Talent Acquisition Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Strayer University (Herndon, VA)
Interview Descriptions: Fairly standard interview process.  Interviewed initially with hiring manager.  Very friendly and easy to talk with and gauge expectations of the position.  Unfortunately, the position requirements changed significantly after our initial interview which was frustrating.  Went ahead and continued with two additional interviews with faculty members.  Both faculty interviews were enjoyable, friendly and engaging.
Interview Questions: How would you find an economics professor to teach in Alabama?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received a call within a week, came in to the campus for an interview with the Admissions Manager and Campus Director, it was a very laid back interview. Pretty much had a conversation. Great Interview! My second interview was with Upper management (the regional director and someone else). This one was a little more awkward...probably because of their personalities but just go with the flow!
Interview Questions: The questions were not hard at all. I have heard all of the questions before so nothing unexpected.

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Strayer University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online for adjunct position for DC location; took 7 months for the Dean to contact me for an interview.  I arrived for the interview 15 minutes early, but Dean and Campus President did not interview me for another 45 minutes.  They did not explain why they were delayed.  They rushed the interview process, and they took another 30 minute break.  When I returned, they then instructed me to start the teaching demonstration, which went well.  They offered me a position; they thought I would be a excellent instructor for their student population.  The next day, I called the Dean and advised her that I would not accept the position.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to continue teaching at the college level (I have been teaching for nearly 6 years).

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by email after I had applied the job posting with a request to complete a questionnaire. After submitting the questionnaire I was contacted by a recruiter. An interview was set up and I had my initial interview in a conference room with two members of the management team. They were very professional and easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: If i was a car, what car would I be?

title: Student Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: It was very detailed back then but now they hire within without interview
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Admissions Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Strayer University (Florence, KY)
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview with a recruiter, then a phone interview with a local manager.  Finally, an in person panel type interview with 3 people.  Behavior based interview-  situation, how you handled it, and what was outcome.  Fairly rapid fire taking turns between the 3 people.  Took about 45 minutes, then another 10 minutes for a campus tour.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you had to handle a difficult customer.  Tell us what the customer did, how you handled the situation, and what was the outcome.  They also followed up to ask if I remembered the customer's name.

title: Academic Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by a interview with the campus dean, business office manager, and campus director.
Interview Questions: Submitting cases for students in strayer360

title: Student Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: easy, behavior interview questions overall had 3 interviews
Interview Questions: What do you like an envirement with rule and regulations?

title: Talent Management Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: Long, drawn out interview process, though they paid to have me travel in
Interview Questions: My opinion on distance learning

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume online and was contacted for a phone interview 2 days later. Interviewer asked a few basic questions and about my availability. I was asked about my salary expectation which was above their pay scale. I told her I was still interested depending on room for advancement. She said someone would follow up with me. I got a call the following day and scheduled an interview at the location. I met with two individuals. Both were very friendly and hospitable. I was prepared for the typical STAR questions and instead was asked to elaborate about some experience on my resume. They told me what the position entailed and what a typical day would be like. We talked about some past experiences and they asked if I had any questions. They said I would hear from them if they wanted anything else. The next day I got a call asking to set up a second interview with the location VP. Met with VP. He said that the purpose of the interview was to see if he thought I would be a fit for their culture. He asked some basic questions about my resume and past position. Interview lasted about 20 minutes. Said I would hear from them if they were interested. Next day got an email from the original phone interview person regarding background check and references.
Interview Questions: The most unexpected question was "What am I missing?" Basically was an open ended invite to tell them if I had any demons hidden away. Not me, I'm perfect and what you see is what you get.

title: Student Services/Financial Aid Department Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Augusta, GA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, and went to the actual campus in person to hand my resume for reposted jobs, as I never got a call for jobs that I was fully qualified to perform. Received a call within days for an interview, which was a group interview with department managers, and campus Director. Second interview was another group interview with department's staff over the phone.
Interview Questions: Extreme lack of professionalism, and tricked questions that I am not sure are even legal to ask. The set up felt uncomfortable and unfair, with a focus on personal questions, rather than related to the position or professional background. If offered, I would have definitely rejected an offer if the process went further. I cannot speak for Strayer University as a whole, but at least the Augusta, GA campus leadership lacks actual leadership capabilities. What a sad reality for adult learning professionals seeking higher education.

title: Business Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview with the HR department, then with the Manager on Campus. After that background checks for criminal records, and reference checks are performed.
Interview Questions: The questions are asked using the STAR techniques. You will be asked to describe specific events, what happened, what you did to solve the issue/task, and what was the result? most questions has three parts to it.;

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Strayer University (Piscataway, NJ) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was cold called by Strayer through my personal network to schedule a phone interview to discuss the position.  I was enticed by the pitch to hear them out on the position because of their "generous" tuition reimbursement to pursue an MBA.
Interview Questions: I took time off a private consulting job (and cancelled another interview) to speak with the recruiter based on a "hard sell" email pitch about the MBA.  The recruiter blew off the call.  When I called her 30 minutes after the appointed time... I learned the recruiter was on vacation.  I was shocked at the un-professionalism and the statement it makes about Strayer, the University, and their culture.

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Richmond, VA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: you submit application online then you get an email from recruiter then you get a video to watch and then they set up phone interview if you can get through phone interview then you go to campus then you wait then offer
Interview Questions: Describe something you have negotiated

title: Acadamic Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was short and to the point by Admission Manager and Business Office Manager. Questions were common and easy. Starting by tell me a little bit about yourself and your background. What is your strengths and weakness? Why you want to work the university? How comfortable are you working with people?
Interview Questions: How do you comfortable working with the immigrants community?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Strayer University (Memphis, TN) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone call from a recuiter, did the telephone interview. Two days later scheduled two interviews at two different locations.  Intervew with manager and campus director took a tour of the campus.  Questions were the star method.
Interview Questions: Campus director wanted me to give my opinion about my current supervisor.  I only said nice things about my current supervisor. I think he wanted me to say something negative.

title: Business Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was a panel of 3 people using the Targeted Selection model. Some of the questions overlapped and seemed redundant after a while. My follow up interview was with the Regional VP and Campus Director. I had to wait for OVER AN HOUR because the Regional VP forgot about another call!!!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Full Time Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Strayer University
Interview Descriptions: structured interview and you have to teach a short lesson. 2 people present at the interview. You have 20 minutes to teach a concept of your choice. Use power point AND the board. Ask questions of your audience. Don't just lecture. They ask everyone the same questions. Mostly what would you do it X happens (focuses on failing, underprepared students since that is mostly what this school teaches)
Interview Questions: none really. Just questions about how you teach, work with under prepared students who blow off the class... Many of the students have flunked out of multiple places and are not especially willing to put in much effort but don't let on you know that - you are expected to figure out how to pass them without admitting they can fail all the work and still pass them due to extra credit, lowering standards... this is a for profit university folks - they care more about student retention and profits than education. They admit anyone with a GED or high school diploma even if they have flunked out zillions of other places - if you can pay you are in). As a result the interview focuses on how you will help them pass and keep them coming back.

title: Full Time Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Strayer University (Dallas, TX) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: You get to meet the campus deans and headquarters personnel . Interview is conducted on campus you would be working at. The campus dean and headquarters make up the panel. You do provide a resume.
Interview Questions: Provide a teaching demo. You have to prepare slides and materials to present to the panel. You are given 5-15 minutes to present the lesson plan you prepared.

title: Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Charlotte, NC) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: First you must complete an application which is sent to the HR Dept for evaluation.  If you meet their requirements your resume will be sent to the campus director who may or may not choose to interview you.  If you're selected you will have to complete a background check
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time where you lost control

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Charlotte, NC) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by a panel of people. They ask a series of questions pertaining to leadership and management. Big on teamwork. Ability to work long hours. Willingness to lead from the front on all aspects of the job.
Interview Questions: Experience level.

title: LRC Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Strayer University (Saint Louis, MO) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial "screening" interview, followed by an in-person interview. The in-person was much easier than I expected...each of four persons asked me one question. They were behavioral questions like, "What did you do when a person in the workplace was upset with you?"  I spent more time asking them questions than answering questions, as if they either weren't interested in me at all, or had already made up their minds to hire me unless I turned out to be a total freak. Immediately after the interview, I received a call from corporate asking permission to go ahead with background checks and references, so I guess they didn't think I was a freak.
Interview Questions: Only after the behavioral questions, when I was questioning them, did some basic skills questions emerge, such as "Are you familiar with APA?" and "How do you deal with non-traditional students?"

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed twice with both the director and regional manager. Both interviews were ordinary and not over the top in the least bit.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Associate Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: There is not much training involved and they required a lot of you.
Interview Questions: The interview is not real difficult.

title: Admissions Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Strayer University (Savannah, GA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very straight forward. Basically it was all scenarios for me. They tell you when you start that they want SPECIFIC INSTANCES of what you did when various various occurred. They include a time when you had to help an employee, how you stay organized with tasks, etc... The good thing about this is since the want specifics they tell you to think a minute or two before you answer. Take the time to think out your answer it will only help you.
Interview Questions: When were you late to work and what did you do in such a case?

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Baltimore, MD) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Travel required; series of panel interviews with predetermined questions. It was obvious that the interviewers were neither trainer nor skilled in interviewing.  Additionally, I sat in a chair in the middle of the room and the interviewers were lined up behind desks across from me.  Typical of a "stress" interview.  After accepting the job, I realized that this reflected the university's culture -- very confrontational and hierarchical.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a university dean?  (NOTE:  I was NOT applying for a dean position.)

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Strayer University (Alexandria, VA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was standard.  However, they always fail to advise that it is for a sales position.  In the interview process they make it seem like you are going to be an admissions officer at a traditional school, however, again, it feels like used sales.
Interview Questions: Are you good in a fast paced environment?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Strayer University (Palm Beach, FL) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Hired within 24 hours of applying
Interview Questions: How do you assist students who can't write or read?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Strayer University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: You are being interview from an less experienced manager or Director that doesn't know what he is talking about. Be yourself and you will be fine. If you get the job good luck! Not the best place to be at.
Interview Questions: Tell us your favs 5 people.

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Charleston, SC) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Quick process and started about 2 weeks after initial interview
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions, be prepared though with specific instances of overcoming employee issues

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Washington, DC) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Colleague referral. Phone interview/screening conducted by HR, then formal panel interview set up. Job was offered via email.
Interview Questions: Interview was straightforward. Questions regarding experience in the education sector and managing people

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Strayer University (Remote, OR) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very extensive.  There were a lot layers in the process.  Be organized and be prepared for the long haul. The interview process was very extensive.  They are looking for people with depth of knowledge and strong people skills.
Interview Questions: How would you teach adult learners?

title: Tech Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Newington, VA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, went through phone screening and interview
Interview Questions: Specific technical questions I didn't know

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Strayer University (Alexandria, VA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was called by a recruiter and given a phone interview. After the phone interview I was set up for an interview with the admissions manager and the campus director in which i'd be working. Then I had another interview with another campus director(tough interview where they pretend like your not good enough to hire so that they can see your confidence and how well you handle pressure). Next, An offer was made via email a few days after the interview. I was very satisfied with the entire hiring process..quick and professional.
Interview Questions: why should we hire you? we have hundred of applications on file

title: Student Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Strayer University (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: It is a generalized behavioral based interview that is standardized for each position.  If you fail to answer a question or find it difficult to verbalize your past experiences, you will lose points. Spend a lot of time practicing "what did you do in this type of scenario" question/answers.
Interview Questions: How did you diffuse an irate customer?

title: LRC Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions:
There was one phone screening with HR and then one interview with the campus dean.  
The on-campus interview was mostly situational questions asking you to describe situations where xxx happened and how you handled it.
Interview Questions: I can't remember anything particularly difficult or unexpected.  It was pretty standard.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: The usual questions plus a teaching demonstration. The process was detailed but fair.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Academic Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was fair.  It was one interview with the boss.  They were planned behavior questions that you have to answer in the STAR form.  Research, know your facts and practice you will do fine.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Trevose, PA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was only asked a few questions.  Where did I graduate from.  What was my major.  Is this a job I'd be interested in.  Could I see myself here for years.
Interview Questions: Where did I graduate from?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Arlington, VA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was very well organized. The recruiter had good details and sold the company well. The hiring manager was engaging and smart. The culture seemed a bit high pressure. They are opening a ton of sites and want coverage for each one. The interviewer however did not asking any particularly probing questions. It was nto a difficult interview by any stretch.
Interview Questions: There were no really difficult questions asked. tehy were all pretty basic. And I'm fairly senior.

title: Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: recruiting forwards you to the campus
Interview Questions: They didn't care, hiring manager was more impressed with my looks

title: Admissions Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (West Palm Beach, FL) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: A phone interview then a interview with Campus Director at that time , now they use a different method
Interview Questions: Best or worst CS issue

title: Admissions Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Strayer University (Richmond, VA) in Dec 2008
Interview Descriptions: Online questionnaire, panel interview which is targeted selection, meet with Regional VP for final approval.
Interview Questions: All questions are targeted selection which means you have to describe a situation, what you did and how it ended

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Strayer University (Charlotte, NC) in Nov 2007
Interview Descriptions: Company called and asked basic questions and gave salary range. Set up a interview and asked questions about previous experience and asked what would do in certain types of situations. Then they went through a background check. Once I cleared the background check and reference check I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about a time you saw where a process could be improved. What did you do to improve the process.
